content: on christmas day as i was hanging out with family an idea struck me i have been playing with jacob s ladders for years now and had often thought it would be neat to be able to do them horizontally that festive day *how* to do jacob s ladders horizontally hit me my family was quite understanding about my need first to sketch and then to grab some yarn and try it out a member of my ravelry group suggested that it could make a really neat coaster pattern and so here we are this pattern is a quick and hopefully fun way to learn how to do jacob s ladders horizontally while making something that is quite functional one fun accidental feature this coaster has is that if you size it well it will hug the bottom of a wine glass you could make them in different colours and use them as combination coaster/wine charm watch for more patterns using this technique in the future this is *not* a beginner pattern there is a photo tutorial for how to do the ladder round there is a pattern for two sizes of coasters and each one has an optional last round at my gauge i got a range of sizes from 4 to 5 5 depending on which combination i did this pattern was tested for colour blind accessibility by https //www color-blindness com/coblis-color-blindness-simulator/ it will also still make sense when printed in the black/white setting on your printer about the pictures the blue/white coaster is the smaller pattern including the optional last round the red/fire colours coaster is the larger pattern including the optional last round the blue/white coaster travels with the wine glass if you tuck the bottom of the glass under the sides of the ladder
